page.title: 14LORD COLERIDGE
page.content: Since then the title has been passed to the eldest son. The present Lord Coleridge inherited the title from his father a year ago (1984), and his son will inherit the title after his death. Lord Coleridge owns Chanter House and its large grounds and 200 acres of land at Cadhay Bridge Farm and Littlewell Farm. Lord Coleridge was educated at Eton and Sandhurst College. He followed a career in the army but has now retired from the army and is a Company Director. As a lord he is now able to vote in the House of Lords but he must first make his maiden speech. Charter house is a large exepensive house to maintain but Lord Coleridge does not receive any grant because he does not open the house to the public. He prefers to keep it as a family home. However the family often allow the Church and
